TEXT: The applicant , a NORP citizen born in DATE , resides in GPE , GPE . Before the ORG she is represented by Mr Jan GPE , a lawyer practising in GPE , GPE .

The applicant and ORG have CARDINAL children : a son , A , born in DATE , and a daughter , H , born in DATE . Following the GPE divorce in DATE , the children lived with their mother , the applicant , and had regular contacts with GPE who lives in GPE . The applicant later started a relationship with GPE who moved in with the applicant and the CARDINAL children . In DATE it was discovered that he had sexually assaulted H and in DATE he was convicted and sentenced to DATE in prison . As a consequence , during the period of DATE the social authorities in ORG made an investigation of the family ’s situation .

On DATE ORG removed the children from their home against the applicant ’s will . The applicant then instituted proceedings in ORG ( namsretten ) of ORG , invoking the DATE Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of ORG and requesting that the children be returned to her . On DATE the court gave a decision in her favour and on CARDINAL DATE the children were returned to GPE .

On DATE ORG instituted custody proceedings in ORG ( tingsrätten ) of Strömstad , requesting that custody of H be transferred to him . ORG ordered the social authorities in ORG to submit an opinion in the case , which they did on DATE . The opinion contained factual information on the family ’s situation but did not express any preference as to which parent should be awarded custody .

ORG held an oral hearing on DATE . The applicant , GPE and their respective lawyers were present at the hearing . By an interim decision of CARDINAL DATE the court decided that , pending the final determination of the custody issue , H should continue to live with the applicant .
ORG appealed against the interim decision to ORG ( hovrätten ) for LOC . The applicant requested that the appellate court hold a further hearing in the case .

On DATE ORG rejected the request for a hearing , finding it unnecessary . It further quashed ORG decision and prescribed that H should live with GPE on an interim basis . No appeal lay against the appellate court ’s decision .

On DATE the applicant filed a petition with ORG ( ORG domstolen ) , requesting that ORG reopen the interim issue or decide that the lack of a hearing in ORG constituted miscarriage of justice ( domvilla ) .
By a decision of DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s petition .

On DATE the social authorities submitted its opinion on the custody issue to ORG . Noting that the social authorities recommended that GPE be awarded custody of H , the applicant considered that there were little prospects of success in the case . She proposed therefore that she and GPE should continue to have joint custody of H but that H should live with ORG agreement to this effect was signed by the applicant and GPE on DATE . Subsequently , at the request of both parties , ORG struck the case out of its list of cases .
